Package oracle.kubernetes.operator.work

Interface AsyncFiber

All Known Implementing Classes:
Fiber
public interface AsyncFiber
Defines operations on a fiber that may be done by asynchronous processing.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Fiber createChildFiber()
    Creates a child Fiber.
    void resume​(Packet resumePacket)
    Resumes a suspended fiber.
    void scheduleOnce​(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit, java.lang.Runnable runnable)
    Schedules an operation for some time in the future.
    void terminate​(java.lang.Throwable t, Packet packet)
    Terminates this fiber with a throwable.

  • Method Details

    • resume

      void resume​(Packet resumePacket)
      Resumes a suspended fiber.
      Parameters:
      resumePacket - the packet to use for resumed operations

    • terminate

      void terminate​(java.lang.Throwable t, Packet packet)
      Terminates this fiber with a throwable. Must be called while the fiber is suspended.
      Parameters:
      t - the reason for terminating the fiber
      packet - the new packet

    • scheduleOnce

      void scheduleOnce​(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit, java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Schedules an operation for some time in the future.
      Parameters:
      timeout - the interval before the check should run, in units
      unit - the unit of time that defines the interval
      runnable - the operation to run

    • createChildFiber

      Fiber createChildFiber()
      Creates a child Fiber. If this Fiber is cancelled, so will all of the children.
      Returns:
      a new child fiber
